name: Katsura Tree
climate: Originates from temperate regions and prefers a similar climate.
Prefers climates with cool to warm temperatures, not hot summers.
Needs a climate with distinct seasons, including a cold winter.
High humidity is ideal, often thriving in areas with consistent rainfall.
sunlight: Thrives in full sun, requiring at least 6 hours of direct sunlight daily.
Can tolerate partial shade, but best growth in full sunlight conditions.
Avoid complete shade as it can hinder growth and fall color development.
Sunny locations promote vibrant fall colors, enhancing its ornamental appeal.
watering: Requires consistent watering, especially during dry summers and fall.
Soil should be kept consistently moist, particularly when young.
Once established, needs less watering but should not dry out completely.
Inadequate watering can lead to leaf scorch, especially in sunny exposure.
soil: Prefers well-drained soil rich in organic matter for optimal growth.
Can adapt to a range of soil types but favors slightly acidic pH.
Avoid waterlogged soils as it can lead to root issues and poor health.
Fertile, loamy soil enhances growth and overall health of the tree.
extra_care_tip: A thick layer of mulch around the base helps retain soil moisture.
Pruning in late winter promotes a strong shape and vigorous growth.
